intro: Mandevilla bogotensis, commonly known as the Bogotá mandevilla, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a woody vine characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of red, orange, and yellow. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant. Mandevilla bogotensis is well-suited for containers or trellises due to its climbing habit.
